item.title: 1.19.1 (Beta)
item.description:
New

Tab-Completion As You Type

On the back of cards, you‚Äôll now get tab-completions to help you finish what you‚Äôre typing. They‚Äôll automatically adjust based on what you‚Äôve typed, to help save you time when writing.

LaTeX Syntax Highlighting

LaTeX expressions now have syntax highlighting!

Quick-Preview for Advanced Tables

Clicking the ‚Äúopen‚Äù button on an advanced table row opens a new quick-preview panel on the right. This makes it easier to look through the different rows in a table without losing your place.

Improvements

  • Imported toggles from Notion now automatically turn into flashcards.

  • Enabled cloze deletions inside inline code.

Bugfixes & Improvements

  • Added email recovery setting.

  • Fixed explanation popups appearing behind AI explanations in PDFs.

  • Fixed header misalignment when scrolling past tables.

  • Top-aligned action buttons in table rows.

  • Overhauled several Flashcard Insights.

  • Moved cursor correctly after pressing Alt+Enter to create a new table row.

  • Fixed ‚ÄúOpen Image in Popup‚Äù for images inside table cells.

  • Fixed AI tutor missing full webpage context from RemNote chat.

  • Polished various small table UI details.

  • Fixed AI text area issues.

  • Fixed color inconsistency in background group highlights.

  • Automatically converted back-of-card tables into multi-line flashcards.

  • Fixed AI generation placeholder showing for multi-line cards when AI is off.

  • Added file links in daily backup settings.

  • Opened the right sidebar editor and focused the Rem when opening video Rems from search.

  • Fixed PDF summary generation failure when strings contain backslashes and percent signs.

  • Added error checking for empty elements in multiple-choice quiz generation.

  • Fixed cluster card KB setting failing to disable cards.

  • Improved error handling for YouTube videos with missing transcripts.

  • Reworked split pane for notes and added persistent sizing.

  • Fixed popup overlay appearing when a simple table cell is focused.

item.title: üéâ 1.19 - Tables V2: Simple Tables, Table Flashcards, and Advanced Tables! üéâ
item.description:
RemNote 1.19 makes tables simpler and more useful, accelerating your learning and thinking:

  • Simple Tables: Simple grids of cells that are perfect for flashcards, organized data, grids of information, and more.

  • Table Flashcards: See the context of an entire table on a flashcard, while being tested on each cell individually.

  • Cell Formatting: Align, highlight, and center content.

  • Premium Elevenlabs Text-to-Speech: Enable automatic text-to-speech for columns that generate flashcards (perfect for language learning).

  • Standalone Advanced Tables: Create tables that directly store their rows (no need to worry about tags).

  • AI-Generate Tables: Create entire tables just by pressing tab.

üî≤ Simple Tables

You can now create simple Tables! These are perfect for simple situations where you just want to put some information into rows and columns. Use them for flashcards, organized data, grids of information, and more.

Create one with /simple table:

Or use the bottom toolbar:

Simple tables are easy to manipulate. You can type directly in any cell, drag to add new rows/columns, format, add cards, and more.

They‚Äôre also standalone: you can think of them as a single thing, with all the data located exactly where the table is. You don‚Äôt need to worry about tags, linking, rows in different places in your knowledge base, and so on. (If you do want those things, scroll down to ‚ÄúAdvanced Tables‚Äù at the bottom of this changelog!)

Formatting Simple Tables

You can add colors, highlights, text formats, text alignment, and more to your simple tables.

Format entire rows/columns:

Or drag to select and then format individual cells:

Tables On Multi-Line Cards

You can add simple tables on the back of a multi-line flashcard:

Header Rows/Columns

Hide or show headers (the gray rows / columns) based on your needs.

üóÇÔ∏è Table Flashcards

‚ÄúShow Entire Table‚Äù Mode

In addition to putting a simple table on the back of a card, you can also create flashcards that test individual cells of a table while showing the context of the whole table. From the ‚Äúcards‚Äù menu on any table (simple or advanced), choose the ‚ÄúShow Entire Table‚Äù mode.

On your first practice, you‚Äôll be tested on the cells in order, one by one:

Each cell tracks its own spaced-repetition history and has its own schedule. If you get some cells wrong, the ones you need more practice on will come back individually later. RemNote will group together all the cards in a given table that you need to practice on the same day to minimize context-switching.

Enabling Individual Cells / Columns

You can enable individual columns from the column‚Äôs ‚Ä¶ menu:

‚Ä¶or enable individual cells:

‚Ä¶or enable the entire table from the cards menu.

In the cards menu, you can choose which columns to practice, and whether you want to be tested in row/column order or in random order.

‚ÄúType in Answer‚Äù and ‚ÄúText to Speech‚Äù Options for Columns

In a column‚Äôs ‚ÄúConfigure Cards‚Äù menu, you can now enable ‚Äútype in answer‚Äù and ‚Äùtext to speech‚Äù at the columns level. All flashcards in this column will have these settings applied.

Premium Elevenlabs Text to Speech for Columns

For language learners, we‚Äôve also added premium Elevenlabs text-to-speech to table columns. Enable the text-to-speech to have words and phrases pronounced on your flashcards.

Note: This uses premium Elevenlabs voices to ensure high-quality pronunciation. These are expensive, so they use AI credits. 1000 characters (~100 words) cost 600 AI credits. We‚Äôll only charge you for each word once the first time it‚Äôs pronounced; after that we‚Äôll keep the audio around and reuse it. (Pro+AI subscribers get 20,000 monthly AI credits. We‚Äôre still providing all AI credits at cost ‚Äì this is what Elevenlabs is charging us.)

üìã Advanced Tables

Besides adding Simple Tables, we‚Äôve redesigned the existing tables feature and renamed those tables to Advanced Tables.

New Look and Feel

Advanced tables now have a cleaner top row. We‚Äôve emphasized the title more, added an ‚ÄúAdd Row‚Äù button, and redesigned the config buttons.

By default, table rows now have the standard ‚Äúzoom in‚Äù bullet instead of the ‚ÄúOpen‚Äù button. This keeps the ‚Äúname‚Äù column cleaner on tables where you don‚Äôt frequently zoom in to individual rows.

For tables where you frequently zoom in to rows, we‚Äôve added a ‚ÄúTurn Every Row into a Document‚Äù option. This brings back the ‚ÄúOpen‚Äù button on each row and visually distinguishes them:

Standalone Advanced Tables

Advanced Tables are still powered by tags behind the scenes, but we‚Äôve reduced the need to think about tags in many cases. (If you still like using tags, read below! Everything is still supported.)

All rows for the table are now stored directly in the table itself, without creating a separate tag in the ‚ÄúTags‚Äù page. When you zoom in to a table row, you‚Äôll now see the document you came from in the breadcrumb at the top of your document. This makes navigation and table manipulation easier.

When you create a table with /table, it‚Äôs now treated as the special primary table where the information is stored. If you create other views to the table‚Äôs tag (using /existing table), a ‚Äú‚Üó‚Äù arrow will appear to indicate that this is a secondary table. You can click on this arrow to jump to the primary table.

Using Tables and Tags

If you prefer creating a tag first and then creating a table from it, you can stick with that! Just make a document for your tag, then use the /existing table command to make a table for it. We still think this is a great way to do things like organizing #Ideas or #Projects from across your knowledge base. Note that we‚Äôve also simplified the ‚Äútags‚Äù pages, to help you focus on your own notes without extra elements on the screen.

Bulk-Edit Rows

After clicking the checkboxes next to desired rows, you can bulk-edit their values from the new floating toolbar.

üìã New Table Creation Options

Copy From the Web, ChatGPT, or the AI Tutor

You can now copy tables from outside RemNote and paste them into the editor to create a simple table. You can then enable flashcards or change the formatting if you like.

Live AI Column Autofill

Enable the ‚ÄúAI Autofill‚Äù option on any column except the initial Name column. When you fill in the Name column, any columns with autofill on will be automatically pre-filled based on their column names.

AI-Generated Tables

Create entire table structures by pressing Tab. Just type the name of your table and see suggestions for columns based on that name.

Press Tab to accept them. Then press Tab again to add suggested rows:

After selecting rows, the entire table with all columns will be AI autofilled for you!

Creating Tables from Images

Paste in an image of a table (screenshot or handwritten), and press ‚ÄúAI Convert to Text‚Äù to get it automatically formatted as a table.

We‚Äôve also made hundreds of bug-fixes and smaller improvements since 1.18.

As with all of our updates, we heavily prioritized these new changes based on our community feedback, on the feedback forum, discord, reddit, and elsewhere. Thank you for helping us to build the world‚Äôs best tool for learning and thinking! Even more is on the way üëÄ

Bugfixes

  • Fixed ElevenLabs TTS failing with a 403 error despite having AI credits.

  • Improved AI functionality in tables.

  • Moved "Image" above "Right Floating Image" in slash commands.

  • Fixed dark mode in the keyboard shortcut dialog and improved iconography.

  • Fixed document content not rendering when switching documents from the sidebar while a PDF is open with the editor on the left.

  • Added basic undo/redo functionality to the omnibar.

  • Fixed new table cell list items becoming orphaned.

  • Fixed flashcards not appearing after a page reload.

  • Fixed cloze cards not working properly in grid tables.

  • Cleaned up custom scheduler settings.

  • Improved grid table portals.

  • Fixed flashcard counter tap issues in the queue on mobile.

  • Fixed card table preview popup being cut off on mobile.

  • Fixed merge columns in tables showing extra elements.

Bugfixes

  • Fixed an issue where highlighting text in PDFs triggered the system Copy/Paste popup.

  • Improved Markdown export by URL-encoding paths to Rems.

  • Enabled "Edit Now" for tables to work in the queue.

  • Added Sonnet 3.7 (reasoning and non-reasoning) to the list of supported AI chat models.

  • Fixed a typo in the "Practice cards with images?" screen.

  • Updated the Magic Copy-Paste and Rewrite language dropdowns to use the standard language selector component.

  • Fixed formatting issues on the 404 page.

  • Fixed an issue where the AI Tutor keyboard dismissed incorrectly on mobile.

Bugfixes

  • Fixed area highlight sometimes not working on mobile.

  • Fixed issues preventing clicks on table properties in user knowledge bases.

  • Fixed definition card table type not responding to configuration changes.

  • Fixed incorrect rendering of the horizontal scrollbar in grid tables.

  • Fixed dark mode issue with filter input fields.

  • Fixed inability to collapse long advanced tables with filters.

  • Disabled the "You can also press Tab to indent" message for tables.

  • Added an insight for Explanation flashcards.

  • Fixed multiple table-related issues.

  • Fixed issue where selecting multiple files at once didn't upload all of them.

  • Fixed resizing PDF area highlights causing them to disappear.

  • Improved language handling in magic copy-paste.

  • Fixed flashcard indicator arrow disappearing in PDF viewer notes after creating a card.

  • Replaced grid table setting labels with tooltips.

  • Ensured the cursor stays in view when using horizontal keyboard navigation.

Bugfixes

  • Fixed a crash when enabling or disabling AI features while the PDF reader is open.

  • Added new table shortcuts.

  • Fixed various table issues and polished the UI.

  • Fixed stuck selection when dragging off the page while making a PDF area highlight.

  • Fixed PDF Annotator focusing on the left part of the PDF after zooming and resizing.

  • Fixed tag filters not working.

  • Fixed all notes filters being hidden under the bottom bar.

  • Improved tables with multiple bug fixes and UI enhancements.

  • Fixed the "Practice All Flashcards in Order" option for the Cards Table practice.

  • Fixed image cells not expanding fully in full-height tables.

  • Hid "flashcard configuration" on the primary column.

Improvements & Bugfixes

  • Add AI autofill for tables.

  • Fixed slow loading on the web.

  • Fixed the daily template selector not appearing reactively.

  • Prevented table occlusion cards from scrolling away when showing insights.

  • Fixed an issue on mobile where applying too large a zoom caused the PDF annotator to jump.

  • Fixed a flickering issue when clicking on a yellow highlight in the "Create AI Cards" popup.

  • Cleaned up names of flashcard keyboard shortcuts.

Bugfixes

  • Improved iOS app stability when switching between apps.

  • Fixed iOS sign-in getting stuck on step 3/3 for some larger knowledge bases.

  • Made route change undo more meaningful.

  • Fixed multiple issues with the Markdown exporter.

  • Fixed checkboxes not immediately appearing when converting a single-line card into a multi-line card in the queue.

  • Fixed some cards incorrectly appearing with a flag despite no exam being set in the knowledge base.

  • Fixed a weird login message.

  • Fixed issues selecting some cards in the cards table.

  • Fixed React errors when scrolling in certain knowledge bases.

  • Improved etymology parsing when adding cards.

  • Fixed handling of multiple PDFs in the upload selector on mobile.

  • Fixed PDF highlight previews mistakenly replacing newlines with an empty string.

  • Fixed some tags not displaying when another tag is deleted.

  • Defaulted AI features to English.

  • Added support for AI converting images to tables.

  • Fixed ElevenLabs English voices.

  • Made it less annoying if you accidentally pick "Import" instead of "Upload" and vice versa.
